Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Implement GKR + KDM hybrid combat system

Major System Overhaul: Deck-as-HP with Brutal Consequences

Core Mechanics (GKR-Inspired):
- 30-card deck = your HP (discard cards when damaged)
- Deck composition: 10 Universal + 12 Primary + 6 Secondary + 2 Tactics
- SP refresh each turn (6/5/4/3 depending on frame weight)
- Fixed deck (no mid-game deck-building)
- Hand size: 6 cards

Dual-Layer Damage System:
1. Casket HP Deck (30 cards) - Mech structural integrity
2. Pilot Wound Deck (10 cards) - Pilot physical/mental state

Component Damage (KDM-Inspired Brutality):
- When you discard Primary Weapon cards from damage â†’ Component Damage
- 3 Component Damage to same location â†’ Component Destroyed
- Destroyed components have permanent effects:
  - Right Arm destroyed = lose all Primary Weapon cards from hand
  - Left Arm = lose Secondary Equipment
  - Legs = movement costs +1 SP per hex
  - Head = -1 to ranged attacks, no sensors
  - Chassis = permanent -1 SP maximum

Death Spiral Mechanic:
- When deck empties, reshuffle discard pile
- Add 1 "Damage" card (dead draw) to deck
- After 3-4 reshuffles, deck is 30% useless cards
- Creates KDM-style inevitable decline

Pilot Wound Deck (10 Cards):
- Separate from Casket HP
- Flip 1 card when pilot takes damage:
  - Capsule breach
  - Neural feedback (5+ Component Damage)
  - Thread snap
  - Taint overload
  - Casket destruction
- Wound effects:
  - Minor Injury (5 cards): Temporary debuffs
  - Severe Injury (3 cards): PERMANENT effects (broken hand, spinal trauma)
  - Trauma (2 cards): Mental breakdowns (PTSD, dissociation)
- All 10 Wounds = Pilot Death

Deck Composition Ratios:
- Universal Core (10 cards): Movement, defense, utility - EVERYONE has these
- Primary Weapon (12 cards): Faction-specific, defines playstyle
  - Example: Church "Penitent Blades" = self-harm + martyrdom
  - Cannot be changed (built into Casket chassis)
- Secondary Equipment (6 cards): Player choice
  - Buckler Shield, Tower Shield, Repair Kit, Pistol, etc.
- Faction Tactics (2 cards): Choose 2 from 5 available
  - Pre-battle deck customization (GKR-style)

SP Economy by Frame:
- Light Caskets: 6 SP (many small actions, speed)
- Medium Caskets: 5 SP (balanced)
- Heavy Caskets: 4 SP (fewer but powerful actions)
- Assault Caskets: 3 SP (pure overwhelming force)

Heat System Integration:
- Safe Zone (0-4 Heat): No penalties
- Danger Zone (5+ Heat): Roll Strain at turn start
- Strain failures: lose SP, take damage, component malfunctions

Example Combat Flow:
1. Attack deals 6 damage
2. Defender discards top 6 cards from deck
3. If 3+ Primary Weapon cards discarded â†’ Component Destroyed
4. Defender loses all Primary Weapon cards from hand
5. Forced to fight with only Universal + Secondary cards
6. Desperate, brutal, Kingdom Death-style spiral

Design Philosophy:
- GKR''s elegant deck-as-HP clarity
- KDM''s brutal permanent consequences  
- Penance''s body horror (losing Primary = losing limbs)
- Creates desperate, tactical combat where EVERY card matters
- Damage isn''t just numbersâ€”it''s dismemberment

Files Created:
- docs/combat-damage-system-gkr-style.md (complete system spec)

This replaces vague combat descriptions with concrete, playable rules.

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")
